column4: I want to make a USB boot drive WITHOUT WINDOWS, and the directions are using windows afaik
simply boot a live CD and create your USB there
OR go to a mac store and do it
sounds simple. How?  .. I dont care what version of ubuntu I use 9, 10 or 11.04 ... From 10.10 there is no longer a usb-creator package
I dont understand about the mac store
install the unetbootin package that will do it for you
as for the mac store, well that was a silly joke, you could use one of there machines and get into bash and do it there
cfHowlett, ok help me. I have a mac right here I am on it. I can get into terminal. this sounds grand.
sounds like you need to google unetbootin
they have a Mac package for creating live USB distros
cfHowlett, --- I see this on the FromUSBStick webpage sudo apt-get install usb-creator-gtk or usb-creator-kde ---- OK I will google that. Maybe that's what I need to know.
that will be the easiest way to accomplish what you are looking for
right about entering things I am unsure of. and unetbootin looks awesome.
